page.title: 12The River Helmsdale,Kinbrace
page.content: A lot of people from the south come to fish in our river. Near our school is the Bannock Burn a tributary of the Helmsdale River which is famous for salmon. The six propietors who own the estates own the river. Quite a few well known people have fished on the Helmsdale-the Queen Mother, Prince Charles and Princess Diana, the Duke and Duchess of Glouster and the Duke of Norfolk. The landowners have formed a river board which is responsible for maintenance and stocking of the river. Four waterbailiffs are employed to make sure no one poaches. Local people are allowed to fish on part of the river near our school. The river is open for fishing from the 11th of January to the 30th of September.
